duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and execute all Guest Experience plans for events.
Support the overall business objectives of Enterprise Center & Stifel Theatre.
Enforce a vibrant guest-focused culture and maintain the safety of all guests, staff, clients, and performers in the venues.
Mentor and model safety techniques for GE managers.
Direct GE staff in managing large crowds under constantly changing event environments.
Support the Guest Experience department through leadership, training, support, and guidance.
Oversee staff & NPO recruiting, onboarding, training, and recognition programs.
Manage expenses within annual approved GE budget and facilitate a strong working relationship with the People & Culture department.
Plan and lead weekly/monthly GE meetings to ensure smooth coordination of events and procedures.
Equip & empower the GE managers to lead, coach, mentor, and manage GE staff.
Ensure compliance and administration of union labor contract and negotiate future contracts.
Enforce venue rules, regulations, policies, and procedures as necessary.
Ensure compliance with the American with Disabilities Act (ADA) during events.
Pro-actively prevent negative guest experiences and resolve any escalated guest complaints/concerns.
Responsible for resolving staff-related issues and working in conjunction with various stakeholders.
Position requires ability to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

education_certification.credential: 4 yr. college degree in sports and entertainment and 3 years related management experience or 5+ years of senior level leadership and management experience or GE subject matter expert with minimum of 7 years related work experience in sports/entertainment. Proficient in Word, Excel, Power Point, ISS 24/7, Paycor, etc. Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field (Master's preferred).
